description:
The NST segment allows application control-level statistical information to be passed between the various systems on the network. Some fields in this segment refer to portions of lower level protocols; they contain information that can be used by application management applications monitoring the state of various network links.

Usage Notes: Fields 2-15.  These are all marked optional since the statistics kept on a particular link and negotiated between the two systems in question will vary.  Not all values will apply to each system.  Some values are concerned with the type of port, and some values pertain to the lower level protocol.

fields.name: Statistics Available
fields.description: This field indicates the availability of statistics. Refer to HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Source Identifier
fields.description: This field identifies a particular lower level link (e.g., a port number).

fields.name: Source Type
fields.description: This field identifies (in certain systems) whether a lower level source identifier is an initiate or accept type. Refer to HL7 Table 0332 - Source type for valid values.

fields.name: Statistics Start
fields.description: This field contains the date/time stamp of the start of the collection of the statistics reported in fields 6-15 of this segment. It is strongly recommended that this value include seconds.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Statistics End
fields.description: This field contains the date/time stamp of the end of the statistics collection period reported in fields 6-15 of this segment. It is strongly recommended that this value include seconds.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Receive Character Count
fields.description: This field contains the number of characters received.

fields.name: Send Character Count
fields.description: This field contains the number of characters sent.

fields.name: Messages Received
fields.description: This field contains the number of messages received.

fields.name: Messages Sent
fields.description: This field contains the number of messages sent.

fields.name: Checksum Errors Received
fields.description: This field contains the number of messages received with checksum errors.

fields.name: Length Errors Received
fields.description: This field contains the number of messages received with length errors.

fields.name: Other Errors Received
fields.description: This field contains the number of other invalid messages received (excluding length and checksum errors).

fields.name: Connect Timeouts
fields.description: This field contains the number of connect timeout errors.

fields.name: Receive Timeouts
fields.description: This field contains the number of timeouts while waiting for a response to an initiated message.

fields.name: Application control-level Errors
fields.description: This field contains the number of application control-level errors in response to an initiated message.
